question: The "Pomier Caves" are locatd in which country?
explanation: Pomier Caves are a series of caves located in the island country of the Dominican Republic in the Hispaniola Islands of the Greater Antilles Archipelago in the West Indies-Caribbean region. These caves are 2000 years old inhabited by pre-Columbian indigenous inhabitants such as Taino, Carib, Igneri people. These caves contain a large collection of Caribbean rock arts such as carvings and pictographs of birds, fish, reptiles and human figures, drawn with charcoal mixed with animal fat. These caves have been damaged by the uncontrolled limestone mining nearby, therefore, these caves have been declared protected areas.
